|availability = EoL |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = 09/10/2004 |estreldate = 11/17/2004 |price = 49 |upc = <!-- UPC number --> |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = B015X6M75Q |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = B000QSLE42 |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |country = <!-- Country device was manufactured in -->

}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== The adapter has two different board types... *CX9207U (using GW3887IK) *CX9207UZ (using GW3887IKZ)
Some of these devices were sold with mounting brackets for '''OptiPlex''' desktops used at that time.
{{WiFiCert|WFA4065|11/07/2005}}
===Additional specifications, per Dell's datasheet=== '''RF Output Power''' *11b: 18.7 dBm (typ.) *11g: 13.9 dBm (typ.) *11a: 13.9 dBm (typ.) '''Power consumption''' *TX Peak: 402 mA @ 5.0 VDC (~ 2 W) *RX Peak: 433 mA @ 5.0 VDC (~ 2.15 W) *Idle: < 200 mA @ 5.0 VDC (~ 1 W) *Radio disabled: < 2.5 mA @ 5.0 VDC (negligible)
==Links of Interest== [https://www.dell.com/downloads/us/products/optix/dell1450_spec.pdf Datasheet] :Notes launch date as 11/17/04, retail list price as $49
==Pictures== <center>'''User Images''' <gallery> File:Dell_1450_uz_pcb_top.jpg|CX9207UZ board (front, minus RF shields) File:Dell_1450_uz_pcb_bot.jpg|CX9207UZ board (bottom) File:D1450 cx9207u.jpg|CX9207U board (front, minus RF shields) </gallery></center>[[Has images::internal| ]]
